page.title: 07Peace People.
page.content: During the late winter of spring of 1985 a large lay-by off the A6 was the home of a group of so called "Peace People".The group,some one hundred and fifty in number,had previously been evicted from R.A.F. Molesworth in Cambridgeshire where they had been protesting about the proposed siting of American nuclear cruise missiles. These people spend a gypsy like lifestyle in a wide assortment of mobile homes-these include everything from traditional caravans and tents to converted coaches and North American Indian style tepees. They recieved with mixed feelings by the local villagers and watched over twenty four hours a day by the local police.There was a general feeling of relief when they eventually moved to Wiltshire to join other groups assembling near Stonehenge.
